result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin S. Sparks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment within 60 days of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and shall follow through with any treatment recommended within 30 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant shall write an appropriate letter of apology to E.F. and Sergeant C.W. of the Tomah Police Dept and submit these letters to the Monroe County Justice Department within 60 days of the acceptance of the Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall abide by all the rules of Probation & Parole.  The agreement may be revoked if the Defendant violates any rules of Probation & Parole, regardless of what action Probation & Parole may take.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall complete 90 hours of community service within 30 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and provide the Monroe County Justice Department, Justice Program Coordinator or designee, with verification of said hours.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Probation in 14CF414, 18CF448, 18CF610 & 19CF169 concurrent with each other.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant eligible for early termination from probation at 18 months if has complied with all conditions.

AODA assessment and follow up treatment.

Comply with any assessments, conditions and no contacts per agent.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.  (Concurrent with Diversion Agreement on count 1.)

Defendant to write appropriate apology letters to Sgt. W. and E.F. (Concurrent with Diversion Agreement on count 1.)

No contact with E.F., B.S., L.F. or their residences unless approved by probation agent.

No contact with Sgt. W. except in his official capacity unless approved by probation agent.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose unless approved by probation agent.

Comply with any and all other conditions and no contacts per agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with community service ordered in Diversion Agreement on count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin S. Sparks
